comments:
Currently, the "Drop to Frame" action is not presented in the context menu for 
stack frame objects that are adapt to IJavaStackFrame.

However, this action is presented and enabled on the toolbar for 
IJavaStackFrame adapter.

Fixed and released to HEAD. Changes in plug-in XML and 
JavaStackFrameActionFilter. The object contribution is now for an IStackFrame, 
and the filter obtains the IJavaStackFrame adapter to enable/show the action.

Please verfiy, Kevin.

Also released to 3.0.1 branch.

"Drop to Frame" still not working.

The following exception occurred while select the action item. Look like JDT is 
calling the action directly on the stackframe object, instead of calling 
getAdpater on the stackframe object, and then performed the action.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Aug 16, 2004 13:43:33.296
!MESSAGE com/ibm/debug/wsa/internal/core/WSAJavaStackFrame incompatible with 
org/eclipse/jdt/debug/core/IJavaStackFrame
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException: com/ibm/debug/wsa/internal/core/WSAJavaStackFrame 
incompatible with org/eclipse/jdt/debug/core/IJavaStackFrame

Fixed in 3.0.1 and 3.1. An oversight in the DropToFrameAction.
